Type.Name: Timer
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

Docs.summary: Provides a mechanism to trigger events at a preset interval.

remarks.para: The Timer component raises the event at recurring intervals, set by the property.
By default this timer executes the Elapsed event handlers on a thread from the , however this behaviour can be changed by providing an instance of to the property.
By default, the property is true and the timer will raise the event multiple times. To cause the Timer to raise this event once only, set to false.

block.para: As mentioned previously, event handlers are raised on a thread from the . It is possible that the timer Interval will pass before processing of the previous event handler is complete and cause two threads to execute the event handler simultaneously. As such, you should ensure that your event handlers are reentrant.

As the Elapsed event handlers are raised on a ThreadPool thread, a race condition exists where the event handler may be executed after has been called on a separate thread. If it is cruical that the Stop thread not continue until the event handler completes, use a stronger synchronization mechanism such as the class.
